data.enText: underpants or knickers
a pair of pants
trousers
a new pair of pants
ski pants
something you think is of poor quality

data.chText: 他们的新光盘绝对是次货！
data.enText: Their new CD is absolute pants!

data.chText: 我们非要看这种烂节目吗？
data.enText: Do we have to watch this pants programme?
bore, scare, etc. the pants off sb
to make sb extremely bored, frightened, etc.
have ants in your pants
to be very excited or impatient about sth and unable to stay still
catch sb with their pants down
catch sb with their trousers down

data.chText: 使突陷窘境；乘人措手不及；出其不意；冷不防
data.enText: to arrive or do sth when sb is not expecting it and not ready, especially when they are in an embarrassing situation
(fly) by the seat of your pants

data.chText: 临时凭感觉碰运气；凭经验瞎碰
data.enText: to act without careful thought and without a plan that you have made in advance, hoping that you will be lucky and be successful
wet yourself
wet your pants/knickers
to urinate in your underwear by accident

wear the trousers

data.chText: （在婚姻等关系中）处于支配的位置，起指挥的作用
data.enText: to be the person in a marriage or other relationship who makes most of the decisions
wet yourself
wet your pants/knickers
to urinate in your underwear by accident

example: she was afraid that her bloomers might have been showing

value.def: Pants are a piece of underwear which have two holes to put your legs through and elastic around the top to hold them up round your waist or hips.

example.ex: I put on my bra and pants.

value.boxr_value: in AM, usually use 美国英语通常用 underpants

value.def: Pants are a piece of clothing that covers the lower part of your body and each leg.

example.ex: He wore brown corduroy pants and a white cotton shirt.
example.tran: 他身着棕色灯芯绒裤子和白色棉衬衫。

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 trousers

value.def: If you say that something is pants, you mean that it is very poor in quality.

example.ex: The place is pants, yet so popular.
example.tran: 那个地方很糟糕，却很受欢迎。

value.def: If someone bores, charms, or scares the pants off you, for example, they bore, charm, or scare you a lot.

example.ex: You'll bore the pants off your grandchildren...
We all love to frighten the pants off ourselves by going on hair-raising rides at funfairs.
example.tran: 我们都喜欢乘坐游乐场那些让人毛发直竖的游乐设施，把自己吓得魂不附体。

value.tran: 使…（烦）得要死；把…（吓）得要命

value.def: If you fly by the seat of your pants or do something by the seat of your pants, you use your instincts to tell you what to do in a new or difficult situation rather than following a plan or relying on equipment.

trans: 休闲裤；男士休闲裤；长裤；休闲裤子；便裤
(尤指女性)当家，掌权(英国英语中用wear the trousers)
